metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8399 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PCRE2 before 10.30 has an out-of-bounds write caused by a stack-based buffer overflow in pcre2_match.c, related to a "pattern with very many captures."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre2-16-0 - 10.21-1
libpcre2-32-0 - 10.21-1
libpcre2-8-0 - 10.21-1
libpcre2-posix0 - 10.21-1
pcre2-utils - 10.21-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> flaw was introduced in an unreleased version

criterions.comment: pcre2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.21-1').
